description.p: Exscinders are Heaven's censors, scouring the planes for texts containing information too evil or dangerous to be allowed to exist. They never hesitate to act, and never second-guess their decisions, unquestioningly believing themselves to be above the faults of mere mortals. They are corporeal manifestation of gods of justice, vengeance, wrath, censorship and command whose sheer force of will and self-rightfulness spark idolisation from mortals longing for a purpose. Devotion to, and embodiment of their guiding principles are often rewarded with destructive gifts from the gods they herald.

sheet.description: The retribution domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy— one of the fundamental forces of the universe—that sustains all life.

description.p: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons.

At 1st level, you learn the Word of Censure cantrip if you don't know it already. This doesn't count against your number of cantrips known. You add your wisdom modifier to checks you make to determine if someone is lying, on top of any other bonuses you already have.

sheet.description: You add your Wisdom modifier to checks you make to determine if someone is lying, on top of any other bonuses you already have. You also learn the Word of Censure cantrip if you don't know it already. This doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.

description.p: Also at 1st level, you can turn harmful words against those that uttered them. When a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see targets you or an area you are in with a spell with verbal components, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. The creature takes 1d6 fire damage and 1d6 radiant damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed saving throw, you gain advantage on your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma saving throw against the triggering spell effect, if applicable. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to wield the power of holy fire with unchecked ferocity.
When you roll fire and/or radiant damage for an effect, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

sheet.description: When you roll fire and/or radiant damage for an effect, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

description.p: At 6th level, you have become remarkably adept at channeling magical energy to compel others. If you cast a spell of the enchantment school using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can change the spell's casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting, provided the spell's casting time is normally 1 action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 fire damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases by 1d8 radiant damage.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turn +1d8 fire damage with a weapon attack.
Once on each of your turn +1d8 fire damage and +1d8 radiant damage with a weapon attack.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, you can delay death for an instant to perform a final heroic act. When you are reduced to 0 hit points by an attacker you can see, even if you would be killed outright, you sprout wings of white holy fire, gain a flying speed equal to your current walking speed, and can use your reaction to move up to your speed toward the attacker and make one melee weapon attack against it, as long as the movement brings it within your reach. You make this attack with advantage. If the attack hits, the creature takes an extra 5d10 fire damage and an extra 5d10 damage of the weapon's type. You then fall unconscious and begin making death saving throws as normal, or you die if the damage you took would have killed you outright. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
